folder: Canal Street & Front Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
47 Canal Street, north side, between Front and Bay Streets (Stapleton), near the Staten Island Railroad crossing, showing a branch shelter of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals.

May 1, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Canal Street & Front Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Canal Street, west from but not including Front Street (Stapleton).

May 1, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Upper New York Bay, Stapleton, Staten Island, showing pier 13, one of the docks of the Foreign Trade Zone, as seen
from Canal and Front Streets.

October 19, 1936

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The south side, of the pier. Shown, too, are the yachts "Trenton" and "Sturdy" (white, right), the former having been a pilots' training boat. Docked alongside the pier are the ferries
"Bay Ridge" and "Bronx."

August 6, 1934

(3)
The same as view 2. Note the "Sturdy" and the black
hull of the "Trenton."

August 6, 1934

P. L. Sperr
title: Upper Bay - Staten Island - Stapleton - Pier 13
